description: Retrospective application for rear lean to/conservatory and outbuilding in rear of garden.
decision_conditions: The proposed rear extension by reason of its excessive depth be an incongruous and intrusive development that is out of character within the rear garden scene, as well as appearing unduly intrusive to the outlook of neighbouring properties, contrary to Policy DC61 of the LDF Core Strategy and Development Control Policies Development Plan Document, the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document and Policy 7.4 of the London Plan

The proposed outbuilding development, by reason of its positioning close to the boundaries and its excessive scale and footprint appear as a visually dominant, intrusive and incongruous feature in the rear garden scene, harmful to the open character and appearance of the surrounding area contrary to Policy DC61 of the LDF Core Strategy and Development Control Policies Development Plan Document, the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document and Policy 7.4 of the London Plan.

The proposed outbuilding by reason of its position and proximity to neighbouring properties, results in overlooking and loss of privacy which has a serious and adverse effect on the living conditions of adjacent occupiers, Policy DC61 of the LDF Core Strategy and Development Control Policies Development Plan Document, the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document and Policy 7.4 of the London Plan.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: Consideration was given to seeking amendments, but given conflict with adopted planning policy, notification of intended refusal and the reason(s) for it was given to Mrs Danielle Taylor (Applicant) by e-mail and phone on 27 October 2020.
